==Events==
*[[27 BC]] &ndash; [[Augustus|Gaius Julius Caesar Octavianus]] is granted the title [[Augustus (honorific)|Augustus]] by the [[Roman Senate]], marking the beginning of the [[Roman Empire]].
* [[378]] &ndash; General [[Siyaj K'ak']] conquers [[Tikal]], enlarging the domain of King [[Spearthrower Owl]] of [[Teotihuacán]].
* [[550]] &ndash; [[Gothic War (535–554)|Gothic War]]: The [[Ostrogoths]], under King [[Totila]], conquer [[Rome]] after a long siege, by bribing the [[Isauria]]n garrison.
* [[929]] &ndash; [[Emir]] [[Abd-ar-Rahman III]] established the [[Caliphate of Córdoba]].
*[[1120]] &ndash; The [[Council of Nablus]] is held, establishing the earliest surviving written laws of the [[Crusades|Crusader]] [[Kingdom of Jerusalem]].
*[[1362]] &ndash; A [[Storm surge|storm tide]] in the [[North Sea]] destroys the [[Germany|German]] city of [[Rungholt]] on the island of [[Strand (island)|Strand]].
*[[1412]] &ndash; The [[House of Medici|Medici]] family is appointed official banker of the [[Pope|Papacy]].
*[[1492]] &ndash; The first [[grammar]] of the [[Spanish language]] is presented to [[Isabella I of Castile|Queen Isabella I]].
*[[1547]] &ndash; Ivan IV of Russia aka [[Ivan the Terrible]] becomes [[Tsar|Czar]] of [[Russia]].
*[[1556]] &ndash; [[Philip II of Spain|Philip II]] becomes King of [[Spain]].
*[[1572]] &ndash; [[Thomas Howard, 4th Duke of Norfolk]] is tried for treason for his part in the [[Ridolfi plot]] to restore [[Catholicism]] in [[England]].
*[[1581]] &ndash; The English [[Parliament of England|Parliament]] outlaws Roman Catholicism.
*[[1605]] &ndash; The first edition of ''[[Don Quixote|El ingenioso hidalgo Don Quijote de la Mancha]]'' (Book One of ''Don Quixote'') by [[Miguel de Cervantes]] is published in [[Madrid|Madrid, Spain]].
*[[1707]] &ndash; The [[Parliament of Scotland|Scottish Parliament]] ratifies the [[Acts of Union 1707|Act of Union]], paving the way for the creation of [[Kingdom of Great Britain|Great Britain]].
*[[1761]] &ndash; The British capture [[Pondicherry district|Pondichéry]], [[India]] from the [[France|French]].
*[[1780]] &ndash; [[American Revolutionary War]]: [[Battle of Cape St. Vincent (1780)|Battle of Cape St. Vincent]].
*[[1786]] &ndash; [[Virginia]] enacted the [[Virginia Statute for Religious Freedom|Statute for Religious Freedom]] authored by [[Thomas Jefferson]].
*[[1809]] &ndash; [[Peninsular War]]: The British defeat the French at the [[Battle of Corunna|Battle of La Coruña]].
*[[1847]] &ndash; [[John C. Frémont]] is appointed [[List of Governors of California|Governor]] of the new [[California]] Territory.
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[Hartley Colliery Disaster]]: 204 men and boys killed in a mining disaster, prompted a change in UK law which henceforth required all collieries to have at least two independent means of escape.
*[[1878]] &ndash; [[Russo-Turkish War (1877–1878)]] &ndash; [[Battle of Philippopolis (1878)|Battle of Philippopolis]]: Captain [[Aleksandr Burago]] with a [[Squadron (army)|squadron]] of [[Russian Empire|Russian Imperial]] army [[dragoon]]s liberates [[Plovdiv]] from [[Ottoman Empire|Ottoman]] rule.
*[[1883]] &ndash; The [[Pendleton Civil Service Reform Act]], establishing the [[United States Civil Service Commission|United States Civil Service]], is passed.
*[[1896]] &ndash; Defeat of [[Cymru Fydd]] at South Wales Liberal Federation [[Annual general meeting|AGM]], [[Newport, Monmouthshire]].
*[[1900]] &ndash; The [[United States Senate]] accepts the Anglo-German treaty of [[1899]] in which the United Kingdom renounces its claims to the [[American Samoa|Samoan islands]].
*[[1909]] &ndash; [[Ernest Shackleton]]'s expedition finds the magnetic [[South Pole]].
*[[1919]] &ndash; [[Temperance movement in the United States|Temperance movement]]: The [[United States]] ratifies the [[Eighteenth Amendment to the United States Constitution]], authorizing [[Prohibition in the United States]] one year after ratification.
*[[1920]] &ndash; [[Zeta Phi Beta]] Sorority Incorporated was founded on the campus of Howard University.
*[[1920]] &ndash; The [[League of Nations]] holds its first council meeting in [[Paris|Paris, France]].
*[[1924]] &ndash; [[Eleftherios Venizelos]] becomes [[Prime Minister of Greece]] for the fourth time.
*[[1939]] &ndash; The [[Irish Republican Army (1922–1969)|Irish Republican Army]] (IRA) begins a [[S-Plan|bombing and sabotage campaign in England]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; Crash of [[TWA Flight 3]], killing all 22 aboard, including film star [[Carole Lombard]].
*[[1945]] &ndash; [[Adolf Hitler]] moves into his underground bunker, the so-called [[Führerbunker]].
*[[1956]] &ndash; President [[Gamal Abdel Nasser]] of [[Egypt]] vows to reconquer [[Palestine]].
*[[1964]] &ndash; [[Hello, Dolly! (musical)]] starring Carol Channing opened on Broadway, beginning a run of 2,844 performances.
*[[1969]] &ndash; [[Czechs|Czech]] student [[Jan Palach]] commits suicide by [[self-immolation]] in [[Prague|Prague, Czechoslovakia]], in protest against the [[Soviet Union|Soviet]]s' crushing of the [[Prague Spring]] the year before.
*  1969   &ndash; Soviet spacecraft ''[[Soyuz 4]]'' and ''[[Soyuz 5]]'' perform the first-ever docking of manned spacecraft in [[low Earth orbit|orbit]], the first-ever transfer of crew from one space vehicle to another, and the only time such a transfer was accomplished with a [[Extra-vehicular activity|space walk]].
*[[1970]] &ndash; [[Buckminster Fuller]] receives the [[AIA Gold Medal|Gold Medal]] award from the [[American Institute of Architects]].
*[[1979]] &ndash; The [[Mohammad Reza Pahlavi|last Iranian Shah]] flees [[Iran]] with his family for good and relocates to [[Egypt]].
*[[1986]] &ndash; First meeting of the [[Internet Engineering Task Force]].
*[[1991]] &ndash; The Coalition Forces go to war with [[Iraq]], beginning the [[Gulf War]] (U.S. Time).
*[[1992]] &ndash; [[El Salvador]] officials and rebel leaders sign the [[Chapultepec Peace Accords]] in [[Mexico City|Mexico City, Mexico]] ending the 12-year [[Salvadoran Civil War]] that claimed at least 75,000 lives.
*[[2001]] &ndash; [[Democratic Republic of the Congo|Congolese]] President [[Laurent-Désiré Kabila]] is assassinated by one of his own bodyguards.
*  2001   &ndash; [[President of the United States|US President]] [[Bill Clinton]] awards former President [[Theodore Roosevelt]] a posthumous [[Medal of Honor]] for his service in the [[Spanish–American War]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; The [[United Nations Security Council|UN Security Council]] unanimously establishes an arms embargo and the freezing of assets of [[Osama bin Laden]], [[al-Qaeda]], and the remaining members of the [[Taliban]].
*[[2003]] &ndash; The [[Space Shuttle Columbia|Space Shuttle ''Columbia'']] takes off for mission [[STS-107]] which would be its final one. ''Columbia'' disintegrated 16 days later on re-entry.
*[[2005]] &ndash; Romanian university lecturer and novelist [[Adriana Iliescu]] gives birth at 66 to her daughter Eliza, breaking the record for the oldest birth mother in the world
*[[2006]] &ndash; [[Ellen Johnson Sirleaf]] is sworn in as [[Liberia]]'s new [[president]]. She becomes [[Africa]]'s first female elected head of state.
*[[2013]] &ndash; An estimated 41 international workers are [[In Aménas hostage crisis|taken hostage]] in an attack in the town of [[In Aménas]], Algeria.
